name: Validate that newly created user is able to login with credentials and then getting that user post deletion gives 404

testSteps.description: 1: Validate that newly created user is able to login with credentials and then getting that user post deletion gives 404 ({scenario=ValidUserLogin, endPoint=/user/login, id=10, username=user1, firstName=John, lastName=James, email=sak@email.com, password=XXXXXXXXXXX, phone=12345, userStatus=1, statusCode=200})

children.description: Given user logs into for ValidUserLogin into the system at /user/login using user1 and XXXXXXXXXXX and verify 200
When User is created as ValidUserLogin at /user/login with 10,user1,John,James,sak@email.com,XXXXXXXXXXX,12345,1 and validate status code as 200
Then Get the user with GET request as ValidUserLogin at /user/login with user1 gives the status code as 200
When User is updated as ValidUserLogin at /user/login with 10,user1,John,James,sak@email.com,XXXXXXXXXXX,12345,1 and validate status code as 200
Then Get the user with GET request as ValidUserLogin at /user/login with user1 gives the status code as 200

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
Given user logs into for <scenario> into the system at <endPoint> using <username> and <password> and verify <statusCode>
When User is created as <scenario> at <endPoint> with <id>,<username>,<firstName>,<lastName>,<email>,<password>,<phone>,<userStatus> and validate status code as <statusCode>
Then Get the user with GET request as <scenario> at <endPoint> with <username> gives the status code as <statusCode>
When User is updated as <scenario> at <endPoint> with <id>,<username>,<firstName>,<lastName>,<email>,<password>,<phone>,<userStatus> and validate status code as <statusCode>
Then Get the user with GET request as <scenario> at <endPoint> with <username> gives the status code as <statusCode>
